Healthcare.title: Apply for Medicaid Benefits (Medical Assistance)
Healthcare.description: Coverage options for children and caregivers, including Medical Assistance.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Apply online through COMPASS or contact your county assistance office.

Healthcare.title: Apply for Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP)
Healthcare.description: Low-cost or free health coverage for children and teens.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Apply through COMPASS or call the CHIP helpline for support.

Healthcare.title: Apply for Medical Assistance for Workers with Disabilities (MAWD)
Healthcare.description: Medicaid coverage that supports employed Pennsylvanians with disabilities.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Contact your county assistance office or apply through COMPASS.

Healthcare.title: Apply for Children's Health Care
Healthcare.description: Application options for children's health coverage, including CHIP and Medicaid.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Apply online, by phone, or by mail using the DHS guidance.

Healthcare.title: Request a Pre-Application Appointment with a WIC Specialist
Healthcare.description: Schedule support to understand WIC eligibility and enrollment steps.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Book a pre-application appointment and gather household information.

Healthcare.title: WIC Program Information
Healthcare.description: Learn about nutrition, breastfeeding support, and healthy food benefits through WIC.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Review program details and contact your local WIC clinic to enroll.

Healthcare.title: CHIP Coverage and Benefits
Healthcare.description: Review covered services and key details for CHIP health coverage.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Check benefit details to choose the right coverage for your child.

Healthcare.title: Renew CHIP Coverage
Healthcare.description: Guidance on keeping CHIP coverage active when it is time to renew.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Follow renewal steps and submit requested documents before deadlines.

Childcare/ECE.title: Child Care Works (Subsidized Child Care)
Childcare/ECE.description: Help paying for childcare while working, training, or in school.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Contact your Early Learning Resource Center (ELRC) to start an application.

Childcare/ECE.title: Find an Early Learning Resource Center (ELRC)
Childcare/ECE.description: Local hubs for child care referrals, quality info, and Child Care Works support.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Find your ELRC by county and contact them for help.

Childcare/ECE.title: File a Child Care Facility Complaint
Childcare/ECE.description: Report concerns about regulated child care facilities.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Submit an online complaint or contact your regional child development office.

Childcare/ECE.title: Request a Child Abuse History Clearance
Childcare/ECE.description: Required clearance for many people working or volunteering with children.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Request a clearance online through CWIS or submit by mail.

Childcare/ECE.title: Request a National Sex Offender Registry Verification
Childcare/ECE.description: Verification letter required for many child care providers and relatives.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Download and submit the verification request.

Childcare/ECE.title: Pennsylvania State Police Criminal History Record Check
Childcare/ECE.description: Criminal background check (PATCH) required for many child-serving roles.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Submit an online PATCH request or use the paper process.

Childcare/ECE.title: Early Learning and Child Care Resources
Childcare/ECE.description: State resources for early learning programs, provider search, and family guidance.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Review available early learning supports and connect with local contacts.

Childcare/ECE.title: Keep Kids Safe: Child Abuse Clearances
Childcare/ECE.description: Overview of child abuse clearances needed for child-serving roles.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Identify required clearances and complete submissions online.

Childcare/ECE.title: Office of Child Development and Early Learning
Childcare/ECE.description: Program hub for child care licensing, quality improvement, and family supports.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Explore OCDEL resources and contact regional offices for guidance.

School Support.title: Special Education ConsultLine
School Support.description: Information and guidance on special education rights, IEPs, and 504s.
School Support.nextSteps: Call ConsultLine to discuss your concern and next steps with your school.

School Support.title: Student Assistance Program (SAP)
School Support.description: School-based team process to remove barriers to learning, including mental health.
School Support.nextSteps: Ask your school about SAP supports and referrals.

School Support.title: Report Child Abuse or Neglect
School Support.description: ChildLine hotline for concerns about child safety and wellbeing.
School Support.nextSteps: Call ChildLine or use the online reporting options.

School Support.title: PA EmpowerU
School Support.description: Resource hub for Pennsylvania students facing basic needs challenges.
School Support.nextSteps: Explore resources for mental health, food, housing, and financial supports.

School Support.title: PA Special Education Resources
School Support.description: State information on special education services, rights, and supports.
School Support.nextSteps: Use the resource hub to prepare for meetings and advocate for services.

School Support.title: Elementary and Secondary Education Programs
School Support.description: Pennsylvania education programs and school support information for families.
School Support.nextSteps: Review available academic and student support programs.

School Support.title: National School Lunch Program
School Support.description: School meal program information and eligibility guidance for families.
School Support.nextSteps: Contact your school district to apply for meal benefits.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Apply for SNAP
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Monthly benefits that help families buy groceries.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Submit a SNAP application online or in person at your county assistance office.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Apply for LIHEAP (Home Energy Assistance)
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Cash grants to help pay heating bills during the cold season.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Apply online through COMPASS during the open season.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Apply for Cash Assistance
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Temporary financial help for families in need.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Apply through COMPASS, by phone, or in person at your CAO.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Apply for Child Support Services
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Manage, establish, or update child support services and requests.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Register on the PA Child Support website to submit a request.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Apply for Benefits (COMPASS)
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Apply for or renew DHS benefits like SNAP, Medicaid, or cash assistance.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Use COMPASS online or visit a county assistance office.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: MyCOMPASS PA Mobile App
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Manage benefit applications, upload documents, and report changes.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Download the mobile app and sign in with your COMPASS account.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: SNAP Program Information
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Program overview, eligibility details, and links for SNAP food assistance.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Review SNAP guidance and apply through available channels.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Pennsylvania Women, Infants and Children (WIC)
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Nutrition and food support for eligible pregnant participants and children.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Find a local WIC clinic and complete enrollment steps.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Report Public Assistance Fraud
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Report suspected fraud related to public assistance programs.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Submit a report through the state fraud reporting process.

Mental Health.title: 988: Crisis Support
Mental Health.description: 24/7 call, text, or chat support for behavioral health crises.
Mental Health.nextSteps: Call or text 988 if you or a loved one need immediate support.

Mental Health.title: Get Suicide or Mental Health Crisis Help (988)
Mental Health.description: Immediate, confidential crisis support with local connections.
Mental Health.nextSteps: Call, text, or chat 988 to reach a trained counselor.

Mental Health.title: Find Mental Health and Substance Use Services
Mental Health.description: Locate treatment and support services across Pennsylvania.
Mental Health.nextSteps: Search for local providers and call to confirm intake steps.

Mental Health.title: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Resources
Mental Health.description: Statewide behavioral health resources, programs, and service navigation.
Mental Health.nextSteps: Use the state resource pages to identify local support options.

After-school.title: 21st Century Community Learning Centers
After-school.description: Federal after-school and summer learning programs for students.
After-school.nextSteps: Ask your school district about local 21st CCLC partners.

After-school.title: PDE K-12 Education Programs
After-school.description: Program hub with school-year and enrichment supports for students.
After-school.nextSteps: Review district and state options for out-of-school support.

After-school.title: PA EmpowerU Student Resource Hub
After-school.description: Student support resources including mental health, food, housing, and finances.
After-school.nextSteps: Browse resource categories and connect to available supports.

Employment & Training.title: Find Jobs with PA CareerLink
Employment & Training.description: Job search, training, and career services across Pennsylvania.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Locate your local PA CareerLink office and ask about training support.

Employment & Training.title: Apply for Unemployment Compensation Benefits
Employment & Training.description: Financial support for workers who are unemployed through no fault of their own.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: File or manage your claim using the online UC system.

Employment & Training.title: Find a Registered Apprenticeship Program
Employment & Training.description: Earn while you learn in an apprenticeship program.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Connect with PA CareerLink to find local apprenticeship options.

Employment & Training.title: Find a Registered Pre-Apprenticeship Program
Employment & Training.description: Pre-apprenticeship programs prepare you for paid apprenticeships.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Visit PA CareerLink to identify and apply for a program.

Employment & Training.title: Apply for Vocational Rehabilitation Services
Employment & Training.description: Employment support and services for Pennsylvanians with disabilities.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Apply online or contact your local OVR district office.

Employment & Training.title: File a Wage Payment and Collection Complaint
Employment & Training.description: Request help when wages are unpaid or delayed under state labor law.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Submit the complaint form with employment and pay documentation.

Employment & Training.title: File a Minimum Wage and Overtime Complaint
Employment & Training.description: Report potential minimum wage or overtime violations.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: File a complaint and provide details about hours and pay.

Employment & Training.title: File a Prevailing Wage Complaint
Employment & Training.description: Report prevailing wage concerns for public works projects.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Complete the complaint process and include project details.

Employment & Training.title: PA CareerLink Workforce Development Services
Employment & Training.description: State workforce services and connections to training and employment support.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Use workforce resources to find local programs and career planning help.

Housing & Utilities Assistance.title: Housing & Utilities Programs Overview
Housing & Utilities Assistance.description: Find Pennsylvania housing supports, homeless assistance, and utility-help resources.
Housing & Utilities Assistance.nextSteps: Review statewide housing and utilities options, then contact your county office for enrollment.

Housing & Utilities Assistance.title: Apply for LIHEAP
Housing & Utilities Assistance.description: Heating assistance grants to help eligible households pay home energy bills.
Housing & Utilities Assistance.nextSteps: Apply through COMPASS during the LIHEAP season and submit required household details.

Housing & Utilities Assistance.title: Apply for Emergency Shelter Allowance (ESA)
Housing & Utilities Assistance.description: Short-term support for Pennsylvanians facing eviction, foreclosure, or homelessness.
Housing & Utilities Assistance.nextSteps: Call your local county assistance office and provide documentation of the housing emergency.

Disability & Special Needs Services.title: Intellectual Disabilities & Autism Services
Disability & Special Needs Services.description: Pennsylvania resources and service pathways for individuals with intellectual disabilities and autism.
Disability & Special Needs Services.nextSteps: Contact your county MH/ID office and request supports coordination.

Disability & Special Needs Services.title: Request a Medicaid Community Living Waiver
Disability & Special Needs Services.description: Waiver services that support community living for eligible individuals with disabilities.
Disability & Special Needs Services.nextSteps: Contact ODP or your county program office to start waiver eligibility steps.

Disability & Special Needs Services.title: Apply for Community HealthChoices (CHC)
Disability & Special Needs Services.description: Long-term services and supports for eligible adults, including adults with physical disabilities.
Disability & Special Needs Services.nextSteps: Call your county assistance office to apply and complete eligibility review.

Disability & Special Needs Services.title: Apply for Vocational Rehabilitation Services
Disability & Special Needs Services.description: Employment and independent-living supports for Pennsylvanians with disabilities.
Disability & Special Needs Services.nextSteps: Apply online or contact your local OVR district office.

Legal & Advocacy Support.title: Older Pennsylvanians Legal Assistance Program
Legal & Advocacy Support.description: Free legal services for eligible older adults, including advice and representation.
Legal & Advocacy Support.nextSteps: Contact the program through the Aging service page to discuss your legal issue.

Legal & Advocacy Support.title: File a Discrimination Complaint (PHRC)
Legal & Advocacy Support.description: File complaints related to discrimination in employment, housing, education, and public spaces.
Legal & Advocacy Support.nextSteps: Contact PHRC and submit the applicable complaint intake materials.

Legal & Advocacy Support.title: Consumer Complaints
Legal & Advocacy Support.description: Find complaint pathways for utilities, financial services, insurance, and more.
Legal & Advocacy Support.nextSteps: Choose the complaint type on the statewide portal and submit required details.

Transportation Assistance.title: Apply for Find My Ride Transportation Assistance
Transportation Assistance.description: Apply online for low-cost transportation programs for seniors, people with disabilities, and Medical Assistance recipients.
Transportation Assistance.nextSteps: Use Find My Ride Apply and select your county providers.

Transportation Assistance.title: Schedule a Ride with Find My Ride
Transportation Assistance.description: Find local shared-ride and fixed-route transportation services in Pennsylvania.
Transportation Assistance.nextSteps: Schedule online or contact your county transportation provider.

Transportation Assistance.title: Transit Options for Seniors and Persons with Disabilities
Transportation Assistance.description: Program details for free transit and discounted shared-ride options.
Transportation Assistance.nextSteps: Review eligibility and contact your local transit operator for enrollment.

Caregiver Education.title: PA CareKit
Caregiver Education.description: Caregiving education tools, planning resources, and self-guided support.
Caregiver Education.nextSteps: Use PA CareKit resources and complete the needs quiz for personalized guidance.

Caregiver Education.title: Apply for the Caregiver Support Program
Caregiver Education.description: Program that includes caregiver education, training, respite, and care management.
Caregiver Education.nextSteps: Find your local Area Agency on Aging and request caregiver program enrollment.

Caregiver Education.title: Caregiver Support Program Overview
Caregiver Education.description: Learn eligibility and available caregiver training and support services.
Caregiver Education.nextSteps: Review program details and contact your local AAA for next steps.

Healthcare.title: Philadelphia Medical Assistance Enrollment
Healthcare.description: County assistance offices can help with Medical Assistance applications.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Use the Medicaid Benefits application and request help with your local office.

Childcare/ECE.title: Philadelphia Child Care Works
Childcare/ECE.description: Subsidized child care support for eligible families.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Contact your ELRC to confirm eligibility and start an application.

School Support.description: Statewide support to navigate IEPs and school services.
School Support.nextSteps: Call ConsultLine and prepare your child's school details.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Philadelphia SNAP Application
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Apply for SNAP to support grocery costs.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Apply online or visit your county assistance office.

Mental Health.title: 988 Crisis Support
Mental Health.description: Immediate crisis support for caregivers and youth.
Mental Health.nextSteps: Call or text 988 anytime for confidential support.

After-school.title: 21st Century Community Learning Centers
After-school.description: After-school and summer learning programs supported by PDE.
After-school.nextSteps: Ask your school about 21st CCLC programs in Philadelphia.

Employment & Training.title: PA CareerLink for Philadelphia
Employment & Training.description: Job search support and training opportunities for caregivers.
Employment & Training.nextSteps: Find your local PA CareerLink office and schedule an intake.

Healthcare.title: Allegheny Medical Assistance Enrollment
Healthcare.description: Medical Assistance applications for families and caregivers.
Healthcare.nextSteps: Apply online and contact your county assistance office for help.

Childcare/ECE.title: Allegheny Child Care Works
Childcare/ECE.description: Subsidized child care support for eligible families.
Childcare/ECE.nextSteps: Connect with the ELRC serving Allegheny County.

School Support.title: Special Education ConsultLine
School Support.description: Statewide guidance on IEPs, evaluations, and family rights.
School Support.nextSteps: Call ConsultLine to discuss your school-related concerns.

Food & Financial Assistance.title: Allegheny SNAP Application
Food & Financial Assistance.description: Apply for SNAP to help with food costs.
Food & Financial Assistance.nextSteps: Apply online or visit your county assistance office.

Mental Health.title: 988 Crisis Support
Mental Health.description: Immediate crisis support for caregivers and youth.
Mental Health.nextSteps: Call or text 988 anytime for confidential support.

After-school.title: 21st Century Community Learning Centers
After-school.description: After-school and summer learning programs supported by PDE.
After-school.nextSteps: Ask your school about 21st CCLC programs in Allegheny County.

Employment & Training.title: PA CareerLink for Allegheny County
Employment & Training.description: Job search support and training opportunities for caregivers.
